skillTree.name: Great Taurus
skillTree.description: As creatures of flame and ash, the Red Bulls of Hashut cannot stray far from the Dark Lands, save for when the Winds of Magic – and Aqshy specifically – are at their strongest.

skillTree.name: Lammasu
skillTree.description: Believed to be a rare mutation of the Great Taurus, the magical Lammasu are the living embodiment of the Dark Land's rage, exhaling sorcerous clouds to protect their riders.

skillTree.name: Bale Taurus
skillTree.description: Wreathed in smoke, these huge, winged Daemonic-bulls are blessed with flesh that burns with the intensity of a living furnace that sparks the ground 'neath their hooves.

skillTree.name: Sorcerer's Curse
skillTree.description: By which the foe slowly turns to stone, beginning with the feet, so they are all too aware of their terrible fate as it gradually unfolds.

skillTree.name: Careful Casting
skillTree.description: A modicum of care is just common sense when getting it wrong can find you trapped in another, infinitely worse dimension…

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% for Lore of Death Magic
Cooldown: -10% for Lore of Death Magic
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Death spells

skillTree.name: Hashut's Scales
skillTree.description: The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.

skillTree.name: Headdress of Zharr
skillTree.description: Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.name: Infernal Engineer
skillTree.description: There are always improvements that can be made to any process; this one ensures the Chaos Dwarfs' war machines and artillery are calibrated to perfection.

enabled_if: Friendly War Machines or Artillery in range

skillTree.name: Reforge
skillTree.description: By which even those born of fire and flame, deep within the forge, can be healed.

ui_effects.description: Restores the hitpoints of units with the Hell-Forged attribute

skillTree.name: All Terrain Vehicle
skillTree.description: Tuned to perfection in the broiling-hot machine shops of Zharr-Naggrund, this machine will get its occupants into the thick of it and out again, no matter the lay of the land.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strider for War Machine units
	(own army)

Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for War Machine units
	(own army)
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Cooldown: -30% to "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Cooldown: -50% to "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Soulblight Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Doom & Darkness"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Fate of Bjuna"
Overcast spell: "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"
Cooldown: -30% to "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Overcast spell: "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"
Cooldown: -50% to "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Survivalist
skillTree.description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."

skillTree.name: Always Ready
skillTree.description: Death is always just a shot away.

skillTree.name: Bandolier
skillTree.description: Professional soldiery means never running out of ammo at the crucial moment.

skillTree.name: Expeditious Endeavour
skillTree.description: What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

skillTree.name: Piercing Shots
skillTree.description: What use armour, or even magical defences, against such powerful ordnance?

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Scouting
skillTree.description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.name: Spread Corruption
skillTree.description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.name: Steal Technology
skillTree.description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.name: Wound
skillTree.description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.name: Hinder Replenishment
skillTree.description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.name: Specialist
skillTree.description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

backgroundSkills.name: Blood of Hashut
backgroundSkills.description: With a Daemonsmith’s incantation, a mere drop of Hashut’s purest ichor is enough to reduce entire cities to cinders and ash.

effects.description: Unlocks Hero action: Blood of Hashut

backgroundSkills.name: Compulsive
backgroundSkills.description: Whereas, among the Chaos Dwarfs, compulsive urges are normally frowned upon, seeing a Daemonsmith chase down Labourers himself certainly is a sight.

backgroundSkills.name: Controlling
backgroundSkills.description: If you want something done, threaten to kill everyone else until they do it.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Infantry
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Fanatical
backgroundSkills.description: "Overly-enthusiastic" describes this one well. He is blindly devoted to purging the weaker races of the Old World.

effects.description:
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
	(accompanying Lord)

Increased experience gain: +10% for units when fighting against the Forces of Order
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Extravagant
backgroundSkills.description: Exceeding sensibility when spellcasting, this Sorcerer has no concerns about the dangers of petrification.

effects.description: Effect duration: +10% for Lores of Hashut, Death, Fire and Metal spells
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Death spells

backgroundSkills.name: Manipulative
backgroundSkills.description: Maybe it's the hat, maybe it's just his nature, but one thing is certain: this one is a devious, slippery character, even for a Chaos Dwarf!

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.name: Vainglorious
backgroundSkills.description: This Daemonsmith is excessively proud of his own accomplishments, utterly convinced that he will soon rise to the very top of the ziggurat!

backgroundSkills.name: Cowardly
backgroundSkills.description: There are those who live for battle and risk death at every turn. Not so, this one, who is more than apprehensive when faced with the fray.

backgroundSkills.name: Envious
backgroundSkills.description: Whatever you've got is what this one wants, and the more enchanted, the better.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

backgroundSkills.name: Greedy
backgroundSkills.description: Kill them all and keep the loot for yourself. It's not a negative quality to be acquisitive as, after all, it's a material world, no?

backgroundSkills.name: Exiled
backgroundSkills.description: Having spent a considerable period banished from their own lands, this one had the time to reflect and improve on their many shortcomings.

backgroundSkills.name: Overconfident
backgroundSkills.description: I'm not saying this one's heading for a fall, but… well, yes, actually I am saying that.

backgroundSkills.name: Selfish
backgroundSkills.description: Me, me, me, mine, mine, mine – that just about somes up this one's attitude to, well, everything, really.

backgroundSkills.name: Phlegmatic
backgroundSkills.description: Stoic and calm, this one is never anything less than totally in control.

backgroundSkills.name: Corrupt
backgroundSkills.description: Backhanders – hell, fronthanders, even, so unscrupulous is he.

backgroundSkills.name: Apathetic
backgroundSkills.description: "Do we have to? Urgh, how tedious…"
